content: What is the name of the first American woman to travel into space, also known for her work in promoting science education?

I believe the first American woman to travel into space was Sally Ride. She made history in 1983 when she flew aboard the Space Shuttle Challenger as a mission specialist. Besides her notable career as an astronaut, Sally Ride was also passionate about promoting science education, particularly among young girls and women. She founded Sally Ride Science, an organization aimed at making science exciting and accessible to students, especially in elementary and middle school. Her efforts have inspired countless individuals to pursue careers in STEM fields.
